ContentClassification.TableReference: Sir Alfred Watson, “The Registrar General's Decennial Supplement, England and Wales, 1931, Part I Life Tables”, Office of Population Census and Surveys, Her Majesty's Stationery Office (London, 1936). Reprinted by Nathan Keyfitz, "Canadian Life Tables 1931”, Census Monograph No. 13, Minister of Trade and Commerce (Ottawa, 1937). Accessed: April 2014 from https://archive.org/stream/1931981931CM131937eng#page/n51/mode/2up/search/%22english+life+table%22
ContentClassification.TableDescription: English Life Tables (ELT) Number 10 (1930-32) – Male. Minimum Age: 5. Maximum Age: 90
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: The basis of the tables is the census of 1931 and the deaths in the three years 1930, 1931 and 1932, but using, of course, the births and deaths of the appropriate years instead of the census population at the infantile ages. Unlike the preceding table, English Life Table No. 9 (See SOA Table Identities 2747-2748), census figures were taken without adjustment for the interval between the date of the census and the middle of the period. Methodology: Quinary groups with digits ending in 0-4 and 5-9 would reduce, to a minimum, errors due to misstatements of age and would give good results. By means of this grouping pivotal rates of mortality, qx , were obtained at ages 12, 17, ... 92, and the application to these rates of King's osculatory interpolation method gave the graduated rates of mortality from age 17 to age 87. For ages 1 to 5 the method of the English Life Table No. 9 was used, except for age 0 where each quarter was calculated separately and qx was taken as the sum of the four quarters. Ages 6 to 16 required special consideration. Rates for ages above 87 obtained by extrapolation using a Gompertz formula. NOTE: English Life Table No. 10 commences at age 0 and ceases at an age above 90 however, despite containing the details of the table’s construction, only ages 5-90 were reproduced in the available publication. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 04/2014.

MetaData.TableDescription: English Life Tables (ELT) Number 10 (1930-32) – Male. Minimum Age: 5. Maximum Age: 90
